messages.subject: sexism/pregnancy? (was Re: Oyate - Books to avoid)
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/15/03 5:39:00 PM, jana@coyotescorner.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/15/03 5:39:00 PM, jana@... writes:

<< Exactly - when men became the force in tyhe medical profession. If women
had that choice - well - that couldn't be good.
You'd have women choosing all sorts of things....
but abortion has been around forever.
herbs, falls..... >>

A friend is pregnant and doesn't want to be. I feel so bad for her. She's
had several miscarriages, and her second birth was uber-preemie, 30 weeks or
something and he was tubed IVd and she just does NOT want to go through
anything.

The day she first thought she was pregnant, she went and rode her horse, hard
and fast.

I fell bad for her, for sure. Other times she was SO careful.

I wish everyone who wanted a baby could have one safely and sweetly and
anyone who didn't want one was magically just by that desire (or lack
thereof) unable to conceive under any circumstances. That would be a good
wish to wish, if someone caught one of those wishing fairies.

Sandra
